column4: hi, for some reason emerald doesn't show up in my package manager, i'm running gutsy with all repos (incl. multiverse, universe, restricted) enabled. shouldn't it be there?
emerald is in universe.  Perhaps your source for universe is not complete?
hm. strange. i didn't do any manual changes to my software sources. it's the same since i upgraded
anyway, how could i check whether it's "complete"?
You could browse the http URL listed in /etc/apt/sources.list.
apt-cache tells me there is a pool/universe/e/emerald directory
alright, had a look at my sources.list, but nothing strange about it.
What does 'apt-get update; apt-cache show emerald' report?
strange, apt-cache show emerald shows the package
i'll try to replace my sources.list with a friend's
for him everything seems to be working fine
Are you using some unusual architecture that may be missing from the pool?
